Maddie Thornham finds the latest Say Owt Slam to be energising and intense

YUSU Comedy Night Review

Jodie Sheehan attends the annual YUSU Comedy Night to review comedians with the likes of Lee Nelson, finding the night to provide excellent entertainment

Self-help Books for Dummies

Maddie Thornham reviews some pocket-sized guides for navigating the daunting worlds of politics and adulting

Theatre Review: Rain Man

Stella Newing checks out the new stage adaptation of the American cinematic classic

Theatre Review: An Inspector Calls

Oscar Bentley checks out the latest revival of director Stephen Daldry's classic

Theatre Review: Square Rounds

Megan Roberts discovers that magical poetry and chemical warfare prove truth is stranger than fiction

Theatre Review: The Habit of Art

Oscar Bentley heads to the York Theatre Royal to check out Alan Bennet's play

Opera Review: Onegin and Tatiana

By James Bithell

Maddie Thornham explores the inner workings of a new opera

Comedy Show review: Shaggers

Andrew Young looks at the success of four comedians, showcasing their talents on the topic of shagging

Art Exhibition Review: The Sea is the Limit

Theatre Review: The Addams Family

CHMS are back with their adaptation of The Addams Family. We sent Ruth Lee to see how weird and wonderful it truly was.

Theatre Review: Arcadia

The Barn takes on one of its biggest challenges of the year with this mammoth production of Tom Stoppard's classic. Kendra Rabbitts reports back from the 1800s.

Theatre Review: Into The Woods

Little Red Dot launch their brand new company with a production of Sondheim's classic Into The Woods. Catherine Kirkham-Sandy went to get lost in a fairytale.

Theatre Review: Holes

Four awful people become the last four people on Earth in this bleak desert island comedy. Ruth Lee went to The Drama Barn to see how they survived each other.

Theatre Review: All My Sons

The Drama Barn takes on an all-american classic of the theatre with All My Sons. Oscar Bentley sees how they rose to the challenge.

Theatre Review: The Bacchae

York Dramasoc takes on a hugely challenging text this week with Greek tragedy The Bacchae. Ruth Lee finds out how they managed it.

Theatre Review: Check, Please

The Drama Barn is back for Summer term with a standout comedy. We sent Stella Newing to check out how The Barn deals with the sunshine.

Theatre Review: Salome

Opera North continue a fantastic season with this production of Salome. Andreane Rellou takes a look at this fascinating production.

Theatre Review: Hymn To Love

York Theatre Royal brings to its studio a portrayal of one of the most exemplary singers of all-time. We sent Rudolf Barney-Seabra to see if this replication stands up to the original.

Theatre Review: The Importance Of Being Earnest

The classic Oscar Wilde play has been revived at York Theatre Royal this sunny Spring weekend, so we sent Ruth Lee to see if this new production stands out.

Theatre Review: Soldier On

At York Theatre Royal this week there is a show that tells a fascinating story of war. We sent Rudolf Barney-Seabra to give us his thoughts.

Theatre Review: The Winter's Tale (Live Screening)

By Saskia Starritt

As part of the Royal Opera House's live screenings, Jessica Jenkinson checked out this adaptation of one of Shakespeare's lesser works.

Theatre Review: A Bright Room Called Day

It is time for the final weekend show of the season and Ruth Lee went to see how The Drama Barn was transformed into 1930s Berlin.

Theatre Review: I Love You Because

After the success of Sister Act, Ruth Lee goes to check out CHMS' smaller Spring production.

Theatre Review: The Drunks

The Drama Barn has taken on a challenging production of a modern Russian political play. We sent Rachel Sanders along to find out how they got on.

Theatre Review: The Mikado

The York University Gilbert & Sullivan Society are challenged with updating one of the most politically dated G&S classics. We sent Kendra Rabbitts to find out how they managed it.

Theatre Review: Hedda Gabler

National Theatre's critically-acclaimed touring production of Hedda Gabler has finally came to York. Ellie Ward gives us her report on this modern classic.

Theatre Review: Sister Act

It is singing nuns and tough gangsters abounds as CHMS bring the classic musical Sister Act to York. We sent Andreane Rellou to find out how they got on.

Theatre Review: Speech and Debate

Taking on the issues surrounding high school life with dark comedy and dance numbers, Hannah Paish went to see how The Drama Barn took on this modern cult comedy.

Theatre Review: Un Ballo in Maschera

In the first part of our coverage of Opera North's spring season, Ruth Lee critiques this new production of Verdi's classic opera.
